017package org.spongepowered.configurate;
018
019import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList;
020import com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken;
021import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.NonNull;
022import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.Nullable;
023import org.spongepowered.configurate.loader.ConfigurationLoader;
024import org.spongepowered.configurate.objectmapping.ObjectMappingException;
025import org.spongepowered.configurate.serialize.Scalars;
026import org.spongepowered.configurate.transformation.NodePath;
027
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Map;
031import java.util.function.Function;
032import java.util.function.Supplier;
033
034/**
035 * A node in the configuration tree.
036 *
037 * <p>All aspects of a configurations structure are represented using instances of
038 * {@link ConfigurationNode}, and the links between them.</p>
039 *
040 * <p>{@link ConfigurationNode}s can hold different types of value. They can:</p>
041 *
042 * <ul>
043 *     <li>Hold a single "scalar" value (accessed by {@link #getValue()}</li>
044 *     <li>Represent a "list" of child {@link ConfigurationNode}s (accessed by {@link #isList()} and {@link #getChildrenList()})</li>
045 *     <li>Represent a "map" of child {@link ConfigurationNode}s (accessed by {@link #isMap()} and {@link #getChildrenMap()})</li>
046 *     <li>Hold no value at all (when {@link #isVirtual()} is true)</li>
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <p>The overall configuration stems from a single "root" node, which is provided by the
050 * {@link ConfigurationLoader}, or by other means programmatically.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>This is effectively the main class of Configurate.</p>
053 */
054public interface ConfigurationNode {
055    int NUMBER_DEF = 0;
056
057    /**
058     * Gets the "key" of this node.
059     *
060     * <p>The key determines this {@link ConfigurationNode}s position within the overall
061     * configuration structure.</p>
062     *
063     * <p>If this node is currently {@link #isVirtual() virtual}, this method's result may be
064     * inaccurate.</p>
065     *
066     * <p>Note that this method only returns the nearest "link" in the hierarchy, and does not
067     * return a representation of the full path. See {@link #getPath()} for that.</p>
068     *
069     * <p>The {@link ConfigurationNode}s returned as values from {@link #getChildrenMap()} will
070     * have keys derived from their pairing in the map node.</p>
071     *
072     * <p>The {@link ConfigurationNode}s returned from {@link #getChildrenList()} will have keys
073     * derived from their position (index) in the list node.</p>
074     *
075     * @return The key of this node
076     */
077    @Nullable
078    Object getKey();
079
080    /**
081     * Gets the full path of {@link #getKey() keys} from the root node to this node.
082     *
083     * <p>Node implementations may not keep a full path for each node, so this method may be
084     * somewhat complex to calculate.</p>
085     *
086     * @return An array compiled from the keys for each node up the hierarchy
087     */
088    @NonNull
089    NodePath getPath();
090
091    /**
092     * Gets the parent of this node.
093     *
094     * <p>If this node is currently {@link #isVirtual() virtual}, this method's result may be
095     * inaccurate.</p>
096     *
097     * @return The nodes parent
098     */
099    @Nullable
100    ConfigurationNode getParent();
101
102    /**
103     * Gets the node at the given (relative) path, possibly traversing multiple levels of nodes.
104     *
105     * <p>This is the main method used to navigate through the configuration.</p>
106     *
107     * <p>The path parameter effectively consumes an array of keys, which locate the unique position
108     * of a given node within the structure.</p>
109     *
110     * <p>A node is <b>always</b> returned by this method. If the given node does not exist in the
111     * structure, a {@link #isVirtual() virtual} node will be returned which represents the
112     * position.</p>
113     *
114     * @param path The path to fetch the node at
115     * @return The node at the given path, possibly virtual
116     */
117    @NonNull
118    ConfigurationNode getNode(@NonNull Object... path);
119
120    /**
121     * Gets the node at the given (relative) path, possibly traversing multiple levels of nodes.
122     *
123     * <p>This is the main method used to navigate through the configuration.</p>
124     *
125     * <p>The path parameter effectively consumes an array of keys, which locate the unique position
126     * of a given node within the structure.</p>
127     *
128     * <p>A node is <b>always</b> returned by this method. If the given node does not exist in the
129     * structure, a {@link #isVirtual() virtual} node will be returned which represents the
130     * position.</p>
131     *
132     * @param path The path to fetch the node at
133     * @return The node at the given path, possibly virtual
134     */
135    @NonNull
136    ConfigurationNode getNode(@NonNull Iterable<Object> path);
137
138    /**
139     * Gets if this node is virtual.
140     *
141     * <p>Virtual nodes are nodes which are not attached to a wider configuration structure.</p>
142     *
143     * <p>A node is primarily "virtual" when it has no set value.</p>
144     *
145     * @return true if this node is virtual
146     */
147    boolean isVirtual();
148
149    /**
150     * Gets the options that currently apply to this node
151     *
152     * @return The ConfigurationOptions instance that governs the functionality of this node
153     */
154    @NonNull
155    ConfigurationOptions getOptions();
156
157    /**
158     * Gets if this node has "list children".
159     *
160     * @return if this node has children in the form of a list
161     */
162    boolean isList();
163
164    /**
165     * Gets if this node has "map children".
166     *
167     * @return if this node has children in the form of a map
168     */
169    boolean isMap();
170
171    /**
172     * Return true when this node has a null or empty value. Values that may result in this method returning true include:
173     *
174     * <ul>
175     *     <li><code>null</code></li>
176     *     <li>the empty string</li>
177     *     <li>an empty map</li>
178     *     <li>an empty list</li>
179     *     <li>Any other type of empty collection</li>
180     * </ul>
181     *
182     * This is a separate value from {@link #isVirtual()}. Emptiness refers to the value of this node itself,
183     * while virtuality refers to whether or not this node is attached to a configuration structure
184     *
185     * @return Whether this node is empty
186     */
187    boolean isEmpty();
188
189    /**
190     * Gets the "list children" attached to this node, if it has any.
191     *
192     * <p>If this node does not {@link #isList() have list children}, an empty list is
193     * returned.</p>
194     *
195     * @return The list children currently attached to this node
196     */
197    @NonNull
198    List<? extends ConfigurationNode> getChildrenList();
199
200    /**
201     * Gets the "map children" attached to this node, if it has any.
202     *
203     * <p>If this node does not {@link #isMap() have map children}, an empty map
204     * returned.</p>
205     *
206     * @return The map children currently attached to this node
207     */
208    @NonNull
209    Map<Object, ? extends ConfigurationNode> getChildrenMap();
210
211    /**
212     * Get the current value associated with this node.
213     *
214     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
215     * or a Map.</p>
216     *
217     * @see #getValue(Object)
218     * @return This configuration's current value, or null if there is none
219     */
220    @Nullable
221    default Object getValue() {
222        return getValue((Object) null);
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Get the current value associated with this node.
227     *
228     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
229     * or a Map.</p>
230     *
231     * @param def The default value to return if this node has no set value
232     * @return This configuration's current value, or {@code def} if there is none
233     */
234    Object getValue(@Nullable Object def);
235
236    /**
237     * Get the current value associated with this node.
238     *
239     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a List
240     * or a Map.</p>
241     *
242     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if
243     *                    there is no existing value
244     * @return This configuration's current value, or {@code def} if there is none
245     */
246    Object getValue(@NonNull Supplier<Object> defSupplier);
247
248    /**
249     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
250     * transformation function.
251     *
252     * @param transformer The transformation function
253     * @param <V> The expected type
254     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or null either if no value is present or the
255     * value could not be converted
256     */
257    @Nullable
258    default <V> V getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer) {
259        return getValue(transformer, (V) null);
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
264     * transformation function.
265     *
266     * @param transformer The transformation function
267     * @param def The default value to return if this node has no set value or is not of a
268     *            convertible type
269     * @param <V> The expected type
270     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or {@code def} either if no value is present
271     * or the value could not be converted
272     */
273    <V> V getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer, @Nullable V def);
274
275    /**
276     * Gets the appropriately transformed typed version of this node's value from the provided
277     * transformation function.
278     *
279     * @param transformer The transformation function
280     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if
281     *                    there is no existing value of the correct type
282     * @param <V> The expected type
283     * @return A transformed value of the correct type, or {@code def} either if no value is present
284     * or the value could not be converted
285     */
286    <V> V getValue(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer, @NonNull Supplier<V> defSupplier);
287
288    /**
289     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
290     * type based on the provided function.
291     *
292     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value</p>
293     *
294     * @param transformer The transformation function
295     * @param <V> The expected type
296     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained
297     */
298    @NonNull
299    <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer);
300
301    /**
302     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
303     * type based on the provided function.
304     *
305     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
306     *
307     * @param transformer The transformation function
308     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
309     * @param <V> The expected type
310     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
311     * values could be converted
312     */
313    <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer, @Nullable List<V> def);
314
315    /**
316     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
317     * type based on the provided function.
318     *
319     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
320     *
321     * @param transformer The transformation function
322     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
323     *                    value of the correct type
324     * @param <V> The expected type
325     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
326     * values could be converted
327     */
328    <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull Function<Object, V> transformer, @NonNull Supplier<List<V>> defSupplier);
329
330    /**
331     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
332     * type based on the provided function.
333     *
334     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
335     *
336     * @param type The expected type
337     * @param <V> The expected type
338     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained
339     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
340     */
341    @NonNull
342    default <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type) throws ObjectMappingException {
343        return getList(type, ImmutableList.of());
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
348     * type based on the provided function.
349     *
350     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
351     *
352     * @param type The expected type
353     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
354     * @param <V> The expected type
355     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
356     * values could be converted
357     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
358     */
359    <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type, @Nullable List<V> def) throws ObjectMappingException;
360
361    /**
362     * If this node has list values, this function unwraps them and converts them to an appropriate
363     * type based on the provided function.
364     *
365     * <p>If this node has a scalar value, this function treats it as a list with one value.</p>
366     *
367     * @param type The expected type
368     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
369     *                    value of the correct type
370     * @param <V> The expected type
371     * @return An immutable copy of the values contained that could be successfully converted, or {@code def} if no
372     * values could be converted
373     * @throws ObjectMappingException If any value fails to be converted to the requested type
374     */
375    <V> List<V> getList(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type, @NonNull Supplier<List<V>> defSupplier) throws ObjectMappingException;
376
377    /**
378     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
379     *
380     * @see #getValue()
381     * @return The appropriate type conversion, null if no appropriate value is available
382     */
383    @Nullable
384    default String getString() {
385        return getString(null);
386    }
387
388    /**
389     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
390     *
391     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
392     * @see #getValue()
393     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
394     */
395    default String getString(@Nullable String def) {
396        return getValue(Scalars.STRING::tryDeserialize, def);
397    }
398
399    /**
400     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
401     *
402     * @see #getValue()
403     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
404     */
405    default float getFloat() {
406        return getFloat(NUMBER_DEF);
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
411     *
412     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
413     * @see #getValue()
414     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
415     */
416    default float getFloat(float def) {
417        return getValue(Scalars.FLOAT::tryDeserialize, def);
418    }
419
420    /**
421     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
422     *
423     * @see #getValue()
424     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
425     */
426    default double getDouble() {
427        return getDouble(NUMBER_DEF);
428    }
429
430    /**
431     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
432     *
433     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
434     * @see #getValue()
435     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
436     */
437    default double getDouble(double def) {
438        return getValue(Scalars.DOUBLE::tryDeserialize, def);
439    }
440
441    /**
442     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
443     *
444     * @see #getValue()
445     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
446     */
447    default int getInt() {
448        return getInt(NUMBER_DEF);
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
453     *
454     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
455     * @see #getValue()
456     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
457     */
458    default int getInt(int def) {
459        return getValue(Scalars.INTEGER::tryDeserialize, def);
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
464     *
465     * @see #getValue()
466     * @return The appropriate type conversion, 0 if no appropriate value is available
467     */
468    default long getLong() {
469        return getLong(NUMBER_DEF);
470    }
471
472    /**
473     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
474     *
475     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
476     * @see #getValue()
477     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
478     */
479    default long getLong(long def) {
480        return getValue(Scalars.LONG::tryDeserialize, def);
481    }
482
483    /**
484     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
485     *
486     * @see #getValue()
487     * @return The appropriate type conversion, false if no appropriate value is available
488     */
489    default boolean getBoolean() {
490        return getBoolean(false);
491    }
492
493    /**
494     * Gets the value typed using the appropriate type conversion from {@link Scalars}
495     *
496     * @param def The default value if no appropriate value is set
497     * @see #getValue()
498     * @return The appropriate type conversion, {@code def} if no appropriate value is available
499     */
500    default boolean getBoolean(boolean def) {
501        return getValue(Scalars.BOOLEAN::tryDeserialize, def);
502    }
503
504    /**
505     * Get the current value associated with this node.
506     *
507     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
508     * List or a Map.</p>
509     *
510     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
511     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
512     *
513     * @param type The type to deserialize to
514     * @param <V> the type to get
515     * @return the value if present and of the proper type, else null
516     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
517     */
518    @Nullable
519    default <V> V getValue(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type) throws ObjectMappingException {
520        return getValue(type, (V) null);
521    }
522
523    /**
524     * Get the current value associated with this node.
525     *
526     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
527     * List or a Map.</p>
528     *
529     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
530     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
531     *
532     * @param type The type to deserialize to
533     * @param def The value to return if no value or value is not of appropriate type
534     * @param <V> the type to get
535     * @return the value if of the proper type, else {@code def}
536     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
537     */
538    <V> V getValue(TypeToken<V> type, V def) throws ObjectMappingException;
539
540    /**
541     * Get the current value associated with this node.
542     *
543     * <p>If this node has children, this method will recursively unwrap them to construct a
544     * List or a Map.</p>
545     *
546     * <p>This method will also perform deserialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for
547     * the given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
548     *
549     * @param type The type to deserialize to
550     * @param defSupplier The function that will be called to calculate a default value only if there is no existing
551     *                    value of the correct type
552     * @param <V> the type to get
553     * @return the value if of the proper type, else {@code def}
554     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type
555     */
556    <V> V getValue(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type, @NonNull Supplier<V> defSupplier) throws ObjectMappingException;
557
558    /**
559     * Set this node's value to the given value.
560     *
561     * <p>If the provided value is a {@link Collection} or a {@link Map}, it will be unwrapped into
562     * the appropriate configuration node structure.</p>
563     *
564     * @param value The value to set
565     * @return this
566     */
567    @NonNull
568    ConfigurationNode setValue(@Nullable Object value);
569
570    /**
571     * Set this node's value to the given value.
572     *
573     * <p>If the provided value is a {@link Collection} or a {@link Map}, it will be unwrapped into
574     * the appropriate configuration node structure.</p>
575     *
576     * <p>This method will also perform serialization using the appropriate TypeSerializer for the
577     * given type, or casting if no type serializer is found.</p>
578     *
579     * @param type The type to use for serialization type information
580     * @param value The value to set
581     * @param <V> The type to serialize to
582     * @return this
583     * @throws ObjectMappingException If the value fails to be converted to the requested type. No change will be made to the node.
584     */
585    @NonNull
586    <V> ConfigurationNode setValue(@NonNull TypeToken<V> type, @Nullable V value) throws ObjectMappingException;
587
588    /**
589     * Set all the values from the given node that are not present in this node
590     * to their values in the provided node.
591     *
592     * <p>Map keys will be merged. Lists and scalar values will be replaced.</p>
593     *
594     * @param other The node to merge values from
595     * @return this
596     */
597    @NonNull
598    ConfigurationNode mergeValuesFrom(@NonNull ConfigurationNode other);
599
600    /**
601     * Removes a direct child of this node
602     *
603     * @param key The key of the node to remove
604     * @return If a node was removed
605     */
606    boolean removeChild(@NonNull Object key);
607
608    /**
609     * Gets a new child node created as the next entry in the list.
610     *
611     * @return A new child created as the next entry in the list when it is attached
612     */
613    @NonNull
614    ConfigurationNode appendListNode();
615
616    /**
617     * Creates a deep copy of this node.
618     *
619     * <p>If this node has child nodes (is a list or map), the child nodes will
620     * also be copied. This action is performed recursively.</p>
621     *
622     * <p>The resultant node will (initially) contain the same value(s) as this node,
623     * and will therefore be {@link Object#equals(Object) equal}, however, changes made to
624     * the original will not be reflected in the copy, and vice versa.</p>
625     *
626     * <p>The actual scalar values that back the configuration will
627     * <strong>not</strong> be copied - only the node structure that forms the
628     * configuration. This is not a problem in most cases, as the scalar values
629     * stored in configurations are usually immutable. (e.g. strings, numbers, booleans).</p>
630     *
631     * @return A copy of this node
632     */
633    @NonNull
634    ConfigurationNode copy();
635}
